titleStmt.title: CERTAINE CORRECTIONS and Additions in the late English Martyrs, which came to the Authors knowledg after the printing of the former Catalogue.
titleStmt.author: W., I.

publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

analytic.title: CERTAINE CORRECTIONS and Additions in the late English Martyrs, which came to the Authors knowledg after the printing of the former Catalogue.
analytic.author: W., I.

monogr.title: The English martyrologe : conteyning a summary of the liues of the glorious and renowned saintes of the three kingdomes, England, Scotland, and Ireland. Collected and distributed into moneths, after the forme of a calendar, according to euery saintes festiuity. VVherunto i annexed in the end a catalogue of those, who haue suffered death in England for defence of the Catholicke cause, since King Henry the 8. his breach with the Sea Apostolicke, vnto this day. By a Catholicke priest
monogr.author: Wilson, John

div.head: CERTAINE CORRECTIONS and Additions in the late English Martyrs, which came to the Authors knowledg after the printing of the former Catalogue.

list.head: Anno 1543.
list.item: Adde, Iohn Risby, and Thomas Rike.

list.head: Anno 1585.
list.item: Adde N. Hamelton Priest. at Yorke
Adde Rob. Bicardicke layman at Yorke

list.head: Anno 1586.
list.item: Adde, Richard Langley Esquire at Yorke 1. Decemb.
Eodē anno put Iohn Sands, & Stephē Rousam in Anno 1587.

list.head: Anno 1588.
list.item: Ibidem, Edw. Shelley Esquire, corrige, Gentleman.

list.head: Anno 1595.
list.item: Adde, Iohn Watkinson (aliâs VVarcoppe) layman, at Yorke.
Adde, Anno 1599. Matthew Hayes Priest, at Yorke.

list.head: Anno 1600.
list.item: Dele illa verba, with a venerable Matron.

list.head: Anno 1601.
list.item: Iohn Pibush Priest, at Tyburne, corrige, at S. Thomas VVaterings.

list.head: Anno 1603.
list.item: Laurence Richardson, alias Anderton Priest, corrigesie,

list.head: Anno 1605.
list.item: Adde, William Browne layman, at Rippon.

p.hi: Yf, besides these, any other errours haue heerin escaped, either in Names or Syrnames, or in the yeares, or places of their sufferings; I humbly desire the Catholicke Reader to pardon the same, and of himselfe in charity to amend them: To whose prudent Iudgment, & Censure of HOLY CHVRCH, I submit the whole.
